result.execSummary:
The defendant Holden S Monte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Holden S Monte is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Holden S Monte was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Holden S Monte

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment hearing on September 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Holden S Monte in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:30 AM. Called 15CM223 and 15CM231, 16TR118. State - both matters resolved - 15CM223 - witnesses have become uncooperate and moves to dismiss for that reason, 15CM231 - plead g/nc to count #1 as alleged and one misd BJ - joint recommendation of 90 days jail one each count - concurrent to each other, fine of $2009.00, 26 month DL revocation, IID, AODA. Cirilli - on 16TR118 - refusal to be found reasonable. Cirilli provides copy of letter to Court that he requested a hearing for the refusal, Court dismisses that case and finds it reasonable. Court reviews the case and is not dismissing the case at this point for stated reasons (request not filed timely) and believes it loses competency to decide that issue. Cirilli - then the defendant would be found guilty on refusal and 15CM231 would be dismissed. Discussion on how to proceed. Off record for discussion (9:47 AM). Recalled at 9:52 AM with same appearances. Court puts off record discussions on the record and the fact that the Court/State will be proceeding with the refusal (16TR118) for stated reasons and dismisses count #1 on 15CM231. Court dismisses 15CM231 and finds refusal unreasonable. 16TR118 - Court finds no timely request for hearing and finds the refusal unreasonable, finds G of the refusal, fine of $2009.00 (inclusive of costs), 26 month DL revocation, AODA, IID for 26 months on DL and all vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL. Court dismisses 15CM223. 15CM231 - Court dismisses count #3. Monte plead NC to count #2 as alleged. State moves to dismiss count #1 on 15CM231 for stated reasons. Cirilli makes statement, agrees with what State has put on the record. Court dismisses count #1 on 15CM231. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Monte acknowledges 3 prior OWI convictions. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - Monte has rejected probation, asks for court costs only. Cirilli maks final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Monte makes statement - asks for a week to report for stated reasons. Cirilli informs Court that this matter resolved less than a week ago. Court sentencing the defendant to the following: count #2 - 90 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - no credit at this point but Cirilli can research the matter and Court will take that into consideration to amend JOC - report no later than 8:30 AM on 6/24/16 - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), costs - take bond posted - remainder to be applied to fine on 16TR118 and remainder of that fine due in 60 days/CO, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned. Back on the record without defendant or attorney present to discuss if a fine can be assessed on a refusal hearing. Court belives that the only penalty that one can get for a refusal is the AODA, revocation and IID. Court is going to change the sentencing to maintain the integrity of the plea agreement. Court will transfer the fine it imposed on 16TR118 to 15CM231, count #2 (count #2 will have the fine and jail and the TR will not). Court puts on the reord that it did discuss with the defendant and defense counsel what it was going to do in regards to changing the sentencing and they were in agreement with it.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Holden S Monte in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:39 PM. Cirilli - not resolved - set for JT - have gone over Frye with the defendant. State - offer - 223 - plead to counts #1, with counts #2 and #3 DRI and 2 year probation with fines and costs plus additional conditions, 15CM231 - plead to count #1 with finding that refusal was reasonable, 60 days jail, fine consistent with OWI guidelines, remaining counts to be DRI. Discussion on the 16TR118 - refusal and whether it should be found in default due to no request for a hearing in a timely manner from the defendant. Cirilli responds regarding not getting the information until March when issued in December. Monte understands Frye. Court continues bond on both matters, finds the defendant has rejected the offer, set both cases for JT, trying 15CM223 as #1. Cirilli will file motion on 16TR118.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:13  PM. Called 15CM223 & 15CM231. Cirilli provides court with auth to appear. Cirilli has complaints, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts, set for FPT. Court accepts plea, continues bond on both cases, sets both cases for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Holden S Monte in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:40 PM. Also called 15CM231. Cirilli handed complaints in court. Court quashes warrants on both cases as he is currently in custody. Court has previously gone over the complaints with the defendant. Cirilli states that he just talked to the defendant this AM and told him he would attempt to address bond today and then set both matters for another AIA. Court asks for signature bond on both matters today. Monte informs Court that he will retain Cirilli today. Cirilli gives formal objection to forfeit the bonds on the cases that was previously ordered. State - bond - asks Court to reinstate bond subject to forfeiture. Court reinstates bonds as previously ordered and informs the defendant that if the bonds are forfeited, he will need to post an additional $1,000.00 on 15CM231. Court sets both matters for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Holden S Monte not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:50 AM. State reviews file as to what happened last time in Court, asks for forfeiture of any bond, bench warrant, body or $1100.00 on 15CM231 and bench warrant, body or $500.00.  Court so orders.

Defendant Holden S Monte in court, in custody and appears via video conference.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:44 AM. State - here for initial appearances on both files. 15CM223 & 15CM231. Monte has complaints. Court reads charges and penalties for both cases and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Monte understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney - has not had a chance to call one yet - does not qualify for SPD. Court - does not qualify for court appointed attorney either. Monte - on probation out of Wood County. Court continues bond on both cases and sets both matters for AIA. Court gives ramification of appearing without counsel at next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:15 am.
